data.title: Steven G. Vandenberg (1915–1992)
data.text:
Crumpacker, D. W., Cederlöf, R., Friberg, L., Kimberling, W. J., Sörenson, S., Vandenberg, S. G., Williams, J. S., McClearn, G. E., Grevér, B., Iyer, H., Krier, M. J., Pedersen, N. L., Price, R. A., and Roulette, I. (1979) A twin methodology for the study of genetic and environmental control of variation in human smoking behavior.Acta Genet. Med. Gemellol. 28:173–195.

DeFries, J. C., and Fulker, D. W. (eds.) (1986) Symposium on multivariate behavioral genetics and development.Behav. Genet. 16:1–235.

DeFries, J. C., Vandenberg, S. G., McClearn, G. E., Kuse, A. R., Wilson, J. R., Ashton, G. C., and Johnson, R. C. (1974). Near identity of cognitive structure in two ethnic groups.Science 183:338–339.

DeFries, J. C., Plomin, R., Vandenberg, S. G., and Kuse, A. R. (1981). Parent-offspring resemblance for cognitive abilities in the Colorado Adoption Project: Biological, adoptive, and control parents and one-year-old children.Intelligence 5:245–277.

Garfinkle, A. and Vandenberg, S. G. (1981). Development of Piagetian logicomathematical concepts and other specific cognitive abilities. In Gedda, L., Parisi, P., and Nance, W. E. (eds.),Twin Research 3. Part B. Intelligence, Personality, and Development, Alan R. Liss, New York, pp. 51–60.

Price, R. A. and Vandenberg, S. G. (1980). Spouse similarity in American and Swedish couples.Behav. Genet. 10:59–71.

Spuhler, K. P. and Vandenberg, S. G. (1980). Comparison of parent-offspring resemblance for specific cognitive abilities.Behav. Genet. 10:413–418.

Sutton H. E. and Vandenberg, S. G. (1953). Studies on the variability of human urinary excretion patterns.Hum. Biol. 25:318–332.

Sutton, H. E., Vandenberg, S. G., and Clark, P. J. (1962). The Hereditary Abilities Study: Selection of twins, diagnosis of zygosity and program of measurements.Am. J. Hum. Genet. 14:52–63.

Vandenberg, S. G. (1956a). Great expectations or the future of psychology (as seen in science fiction).Am. Psychologist 11:339–342.

Vandenberg, S. G. (1956b). A Chinese classic on individual differences.Am. Psychologist 11:714–715.

Vandenberg, S. G. (1959). The primary mental abilities of Chinese students: A comparative study of the stability of a factor structure.Ann. N.Y. Acad. Sci. 79:257–304.

Vandenberg, S. G. (1960a). Behavioral methods for assessing neuroses and psychoses. In Miller, J. G. and Uhr, L. (eds.),Drugs and Behavior, Wiley, New York, pp. 463–500.

Vandenberg, S. G. (1960b). Medical diagnosis by computer: Recent attempts and outlook for the future.Behav. Sci. 5:170–174.

Vandenberg, S. G. (1962a). How “stable” are heritability estimates? A comparison of heritability estimates from six anthropometric studies.Am. J. Phys. Anthropol. 20:331–338.

Vandenberg, S. G. (1962b). The Hereditary Abilities Study: Hereditary components in a psychological test battery.Am. J. Hum. Genet. 14:220–237.

Vandenberg, S. G. (1964). Factor analytic studies of the Lincoln Oseretsky test of motor proficiency.Percept. Motor Skills 19:23–41.

Vandenberg, S. G. (1965a). Innate abilities, one or many? A new method and some results.Acta Genet. Med. Gemellol. 14:41–47.

Vandenberg, S. G. (ed.) (1965b).Methods and Goals in Human Behavior Genetics, Academic Press, New York.

Vandenberg, S. G. (1966). Contributions of twin research to psychology.Psychol. Bull. 66:327–352.

Vandenberg, S. G. (1967a). Hereditary factors in normal personality traits (as measured by inventories). In Wortis, J. (ed.),Recent Advances in Biological Psychiatry, Vol. 9, Plenum, New York, pp. 65–104.

Vandenberg, S. G. (1967b). The primary mental abilities of South American students: A second comparative study of the generality of a cognitive factor structure.Multivar. Behav. Res. 2:175–198.

Vandenberg, S. G. (1968a). A factor analysis of garment measures of Dutch women.Hum. Biol. 40:295–313.

Vandenberg, S. G. (ed.) (1968b).Progress in Human Behavior Genetics, Johns Hopkins Press, Baltimore.

Vandenberg, S. G. (1969). A twin study of spatial ability.Multivar. Behav. Res. 4:273–294.

Vandenberg, S. G. (1970a). A comparison of heritability estimates of US Negro and White high school students.Acta Genet. Med. Gemellol. 19:280–284.

Vandenberg, S. G. (1970b). Genetic factors in poverty: A psychologist's point of view. In Allen, V. L. (ed.)Psychological Factors in Poverty, Markham, Chicago, pp. 161–175.

Vandenberg, S. G. (1972). Assortative mating, or who marries whom?Behav. Genet. 2:127–157.

Vandenberg, S. G. (1976). Genetic factors in human learning.Educ. Psychologist 12:59–63.

Vandenberg, S. G. (1977). Hereditary influences on voice, speech, and language.Sign Lang. Stud. 15:169–182.

Vandenberg, S. G. (1984). Does a special twin situation contribute to similarity for abilities in MZ and DZ twins?Acta Genet. Med. Gemellol. 33:219–222.

Vandenberg, S. G. and Falkner, F. (1965). Hereditary factors in human growth.Hum. Biol. 37:357–365.

Vandenberg, S. G. and Kuse, A. R. (1978). Mental rotations, a group test of three-dimensional spatial visualization.Percept. Motor Skills 47:599–604.

Vandenberg, S. G. and Mattson, E. (1961). The interpretation of facial expressions by schizophrenics, other mental patients, normal adults and children.Acta Psychol. 19:495–497.

Vandenberg, S. G., McKusick, V. A., and McKusick, A. (1962). Twin data in support of the Lyon hypothesis.Nature 194:505–506.
